starvationevasion.common.messages

Class Discard

  • java.lang.Object
    • starvationevasion.common.messages.Discard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Discard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Shea Polansky A message from client to server indicating that it wishes to discard card(s). May be used to represent either a free discard action (which uses the single- argument constructor and may be performed once per turn independent of other actions) or a non-free discard action (which uses the three argument constructor and may be used in place of a draft action each draft phase). Arguments in the three-argument constructor may be null (e.g. new Discard(policyA, policyB, null)) to indicate fewer than three cards are intended to be discarded.
    See Also:

      • Discard

        public Discard(EnumPolicy discard1,
               EnumPolicy discard2,
               EnumPolicy discard3)
        Creates a new Discard action that represents a non-free discard action. At least one argument must be non-null.
        Parameters:
        discard1 - the first card to discard
        discard2 - the second card to discard
        discard3 - the third card to discard
